articleContent.title: Chord: Minor Major 7th in F (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Minor Major 7th in F (Shape: D)

## Brief Description
The Minor Major 7th chord in the key of F, played in the D shape, features a complex yet rich and melancholic sound. It consists of a minor triad, with the addition of a major seventh interval, creating a dissonant but distinctive tonality.

## Notes and Intervals
The F Minor Major 7th chord in the D shape comprises the notes F, Ab, C, and E. It includes a minor third (F to Ab), perfect fifth (F to C), and major seventh (F to E) intervals.

## Musical Genre and Flavor
This chord is often found in jazz, R&B, and soul music due to its sophisticated and emotive nature. It adds a touch of tension and introspection to compositions, making it particularly suitable for ballads, emotional songs, and pieces with a contemplative atmosphere.

## Songs
1. **"Misty" by Erroll Garner**: This jazz standard showcases the expressive quality of the Minor Major 7th chord in a melodic and tender piano arrangement.
  
2. **"Dock of the Bay" by Otis Redding**: While largely based on a major tonality, this soul classic incorporates the Minor Major 7th chord to infuse a hint of soulful melancholy into the song's chord progression.

3. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones**: Known for its smooth and mellow vibe, this song features the Minor Major 7th chord to enhance the emotional depth of the ballad.
